the nanopowders were received via annealing of resin at 1100
C for 16 h in air atmosphere.
raction (XRD) studies were carried out on PANalytical X’Pert Pro di
equipped with Anton Paar TCU 1000 N Temperature Control Unit using Ni-ﬁltered Cu
Transmission electron microscope images were taken using transmission electron microscopy
(TEM) Philips CM-20 SuperTwin with 160 kV of accelerating voltage and 0.25 nmof optical resolution.
The hydrodynamic size of the nanoparticles was determined by dynamic light scattering (DLS),
conducted in Malvern ZetaSizer at roomtemperature in polystyrene cuvette, using distilled water as
The emission spectra were measured using the 266 nmexcitation line froma laser diode (LD) and
a Silver-Nova Super Range TEC Spectrometer formStellarnet (1 nmspectral resolution) as a detector.
The temperature of the sample was controlled using a THMS600 heating stage from Linkam (0.1 1C
temperature stability and 0.1 1C set point resolution).
Luminescence decay proﬁles were recorded using FLS980 Fluorescence Spectrometer from
Flash lamp as an excitation source and R928P side window
photomultiplier tube fromHamamatsu as a detector.
gallium garnets crystallize in a cubic structure of Ia3d space group.
The general formula of garnets is expressed as follows: A
sites are represented by dodecahedral site (A), octahedral site (B) and tetrahedral site (C), which in
our case are occupied by eight-fold coordinated Y
ions, respectively. The optically active ions introduced to the structure
erent crystallographic sites, which results from the similarities in the coordination
number, ionic radii and ionic charge between the host and dopant metal. Therefore, lanthanides
) prefer to replace A site, while (TM) mainly substitute B and C sites. Additionally, depending
on the size of TM ion, they occupy larger (B) (ionic radii 0.67 Å for Al
) metallic sites. An XRD analysis was used to verify
the phase purity of synthesized materials. It is evident that the obtained di
nanocrystals correspond to the reference patterns of cubic structures of adequate host
a). Observed peaks broadening can be assigned to the small size of the nanoparticles.
cell parameter increases linearly as the Ga

rather than the octahedral counterpart. This phenomenon can be
explained based on the stronger covalency of Ga
bonds with respect to the Al
the lowering of repulsive forces between cations, providing stabilization of the crystal structure [
On the other hand, the slight shift of the XRD peaks with respect to the reference pattern arises
from the implementation of V ions into Y
lattice. It was found that Y
matrix is a suitable host material for three di
erent V oxidation states, namely V
ions by Vions is possible due to their comparable ionic radii, which in
the case of four-fold coordinated V
ions are 0.54 Å, 0.64 Å, respectively, and for six-fold
ions are 0.68 Å, 0.72 Å and 0.78 Å, respectively. As can be seen fromthe
TEMimages, synthesized powders consist of well-crystalized and highly agglomerated nanocrystals
